ngiemboon: À ka lɔ́ɔn mbab e tè vfó, e taŋa lê pfâd.
en: He cooked the meat poorly and it’s not very tender.

ngiemboon: À kÿǒ tà ńzyɛ́ʼɛ mvfò mèŋ lê pfǎd.
en: He walked past me in a hurry.
sound of a hoe digging the ground

ngiemboon: Mèŋ n dɔgɔ́ shú, ńjʉ́ʼʉ nɔ̀ɔn lê pfùb pfùb tà ḿmag.
en: With the hoe, I cultivated “pfùb pfùb” until I finished.
those there (distant demonstrative pronoun referring to class 2 nouns)
those ... there (distant demonstrative adjective modifying class 2 nouns)
Look at these people before you see.
What level did you go to?
your (third person plural possessive adjective modifying any class noun after preposition or a movement verb)
yours (second person plural possessive pronoun referring back to class 2 nouns)
your (second person plural possessive adjective modifying class 2 nouns)
your (second person plural emphatic possessive adjective modifying class 2 nouns)
It’s your people who are many.

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ fʉ̌ʼ nò tà ɔ̀ ge laŋa píd ɔ̀ fʉ̀ʼɔɔn.
en: You made stupid mistakes, now you will see the consequences.
